title: Indian crafts: Hopi, Navajo and Iroquois
creator_credit: Nancy Creedman and BFA Educational Media
brief_description: An introduction to the different crafts of three North American Indian tribes. Crafts shown include the weaving of the yucca plant into baskets by the Hopi tribe; the weaving of blankets and the making of silver jewellery by the navajo tribe; and the carving of special masks by the Iroquois tribe from basswood trees.
